lead_paragraph: LINSTROM--Christopher, M.D. of New York and Ho-Ho-Kus, New Jersey died suddenly on February 17th. He was 65 years old. He had been the Surgeon Director of Otology, Neurotology and Skull Base Surgery at The New York Eye and Ear Infirmary, New York City. He was Professor of Otolaryngology at the New York Medical College, Valhalla, New York. He had been a visiting professor in Otolaryngology at The Medical University of Southern Africa (MEDUNSA), Pretoria, RSA. He is a Fellow of the American Board of Otolaryngology, of the Royal College of Surgeons (Canada), and of the Royal College of Surgeons of England. Christopher Linstrom was born in Washington, D.C., and raised in Maryland. He finished degrees in philosophy and music at the University of Maryland. His medical studies and internship were taken at McGill University, Montreal. While in medical school, he founded and was the president of the McGill Faculty of Medicine Refugee Fund to benefit the Boat People from Vietnam. Cherished partner of Swee Khing Hong, brother of Mary (David) Major, John (Karen) Linstrom, Katherine (Jeffrey Griffen) Linstrom, Nora (Stephen Burch) Linstrom, Joan (Kenneth Jones) Linstrom, Gerard (Allison Lentz) Linstrom, Elizabeth (Larry Burch) Linstrom, David (Stacy Humphrey) Linstrom and many nieces and nephews, grand nieces and grand nephews. Friends may call at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel 1076 Madison Avenue at 81st Street on Sunday, February 21st from 3pm to 8pm. A second wake will be held on Thursday, February 25th at the Borgwardt Funeral Home, 4400 Powder Mill Road, Beltsville MD from 2pm to 4pm and from 7pm to 9pm. A mass of Christian burial will be held on Friday, February 26th, 10am at Saint Hugh Grenoble Catholic Church of Greenbelt MD followed by internment at Fort Lincoln Cemetery in Bladenburg, MD. In lieu of flowers his family has requested donations be made in Christopher's name to Franciscan Friars, Province of The Sacred Heart P.O.Box 137 Loretto, PA,15940 and/or McGill University Faculty of Medicine 1010 Sherbrooke WestSuite 1210 Montreal Canada H3A2R7 in the name of "The Linstrom Family Fund" to support the medical education of student(s) from low income families. 1/3
